network_vlans.description: Default VLAN for all switch ports. All ports should be moved to a designated VLAN. Any active device in this segment is considered a misconfiguration.
network_vlans.security_policy_summary: No access to any resources. All traffic is logged and dropped. Generates an alert if a new device is seen.

network_vlans.description: General corporate user workstations for Sales, Marketing, and Operations at the London HQ.
network_vlans.security_policy_summary: Allowed outbound internet access via proxy. Allowed access to Server Farm on ports 443, 1433, 8080. Allowed access to File Servers on port 445. RDP/SSH from this VLAN to servers is forbidden.

network_vlans.description: Restricted VLAN for Human Resources workstations handling sensitive PII.
network_vlans.security_policy_summary: Same as Main Office, but with stricter data loss prevention (DLP) rules on outbound traffic. Internet access is limited to whitelisted domains.

network_vlans.description: Secure VLAN for IT administrators, privileged access workstations (PAWs), and security tools like vulnerability scanners.
network_vlans.security_policy_summary: Highly restricted internet access. Allowed to initiate RDP and SSH to all internal server VLANs. Source for authorized vulnerability scans.

network_vlans.description: Sandbox environment for developers. Contains staging and test servers.
network_vlans.security_policy_summary: Permissive outbound internet access. Intra-VLAN traffic is unrestricted to allow for testing. Access to Production Server VLANs is strictly forbidden, except for read-only access to specific database replicas.

network_vlans.description: Network segment for all corporate printers and multi-function devices.
network_vlans.security_policy_summary: No internet access allowed. Can only be accessed from workstation VLANs on specific printing-related ports. Should never initiate outbound connections.

network_vlans.description: Dedicated VLAN for VoIP phones to ensure quality of service (QoS).
network_vlans.security_policy_summary: Isolated segment. Can only communicate with the VoIP provider's servers and the internal phone management system. No internet browsing or access to corporate servers.

network_vlans.description: Houses all core production application and database servers (CRM, etc.).
network_vlans.security_policy_summary: Strictly controlled. No general outbound internet access. Allowed outbound connections only to specific, whitelisted external APIs (e.g., Salesforce, Microsoft Update). Should never initiate connections to workstation VLANs.

network_vlans.description: A dedicated segment within the server farm for the primary file servers.
network_vlans.security_policy_summary: No internet access. Only allows inbound SMB/NFS traffic (port 445/2049) from internal workstation and server VLANs. Outbound traffic is denied by default.

network_vlans.description: Demilitarized Zone for public-facing services like the corporate website and Outlook Web Access (OWA).
network_vlans.security_policy_summary: Inbound internet traffic is allowed only on TCP/80 and TCP/443. Traffic from the DMZ initiating connections to the internal network is STRICTLY FORBIDDEN, especially on management ports like RDP/SSH or file sharing ports like SMB.

network_vlans.description: Logical zone for remote users connected via the corporate VPN.
network_vlans.security_policy_summary: Once authenticated, users are treated as if they are on a restricted version of the Main Office VLAN. Access is explicitly defined by rules on the VPN concentrator and internal firewall.

network_vlans.description: Provides internet access for guests and personal devices. Must be completely isolated from the corporate network.
network_vlans.security_policy_summary: Internet access only. All access to internal IP ranges is blocked. Client isolation is enabled to prevent guests from communicating with each other.
